timeline.title: The Foundation
timeline.description: Founded by John and Faith Singh when Jaipur's block printing industry was at a very low ebb. ANOKHI started working with craftspeople in and around Jaipur to help revitalise age-old skills.

timeline.title: Early Collections
timeline.description: ANOKHI began with small clothing collections, developing striking ranges around traditional techniques while infusing pieces with contemporary twists for modern users.

timeline.title: International Expansion
timeline.description: Traditional prints were re-imagined as stylish evening dresses, bolero jackets and kaftans, sold through boutiques across England and expanding globally.

timeline.title: Next Generation
timeline.description: ANOKHI was placed in the hands of the next generation, who continued to find inventive ways to sustain secure livelihoods for employees and artisanal relationships.

timeline.title: Museum Foundation
timeline.description: ANOKHI founded the Anokhi Museum of Hand Printing, dedicated to the collection, preservation and interpretation of block printed fabric.

timeline.title: Continuing Legacy
timeline.description: ANOKHI remains deeply committed to supporting traditional craftsmanship and its continued revival, with shops across India and global recognition.

craftsmanship.title: The Art of Hand-Block Printing
craftsmanship.description: Our textiles are created using traditional hand-block printing techniques passed down through generations of skilled artisans.

process.description: Each design begins as a hand-drawn pattern, carefully crafted by our design team in collaboration with master artisans.
Master craftsmen carve intricate designs into wooden blocks, each one unique and handcrafted with precision.
We use only natural, eco-friendly dyes derived from plants, minerals, and other organic sources.
Artisans hand-print each piece using traditional techniques, ensuring every item is unique and authentic.
Each finished piece undergoes rigorous quality checks to ensure it meets our high standards.
